title: Will there be any single day in December 2017 during which 15 or more Ukrainian military personnel are killed?
preds: Most people will get this wrong because the violence in the Ukraine is ratcheting up yet American news outlets are not really reporting on this. 15 Ukranian soldiers in one day is a lot but I do think the chances are high.
Fifteen would be a severe escalation, and I don't have priors for a full scale war in the short run, so no.
Highly unlikely given limited time left in the month, winter weather and holidays.
no,  that   conflict   has  cooled  off there  will  be  a  resurgence  in  the  spring
Probably closer to zero but there is still a possibility.
While there could be a sudden flare up between Christmas and New Years, so far the fighting hasn't been that heavy and the month is almost over.
There are not many days left in December 2017, and 15 or more fatalities would be a large number to randomly occur in such a short space of time.
Multiple Attacks, but no large attack, Russian major holiday Jan 1, 2018 will be a slow down

Russia is freaked out over the prospect of US entry into this conflict. Despite their bluster they know they can't face the US military in a conventional conflict, and facing US provided weapons is almost as scary. They will try and cool this conflict a bit until they can get Trump to back off.
Lowering. Prisoner swap on Dec. 27th. Probably neither side wants to mess that up. Might squeak through until new year but this conflict is going to heat up.
heating up with US sale of lethal force to Ukraine.
Does not seem to have an escalation.
Lowering but with Russia saying more violence will result from anti-tank missiles going to Ukraine it is still possible.
Time to hike the probability based on news of more intense fighting in the last few days.
Fighting has intensified. 6 killed in one day and fighting seems to be ramping up. It has not reached that many yet but easily could.
Putin wants more US co-operation in other areas so will back off on any disruption in the Ukraine.
Upcoming Russian election likely a stabilizing factor. Conflict currently in low-intensity phase.

Appears to be low intensity conflict now with separatists in Donetsk region having control of their area and being written off by rest of Ukraine. https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/nov/12/ukraine-on-the-front-line-of-europes-forgotten-war
KIAs have been common over the year but rarely spiked above single digits in the limited reporting I have seen.
